The CMUS Xoán Montes of Lugo, is a Professional Music Conservatory situated in the city of Lugo. The conservatory has 549 students, of ages that go mainly from 8 to 18, and 54 teachers. The city of Lugo is a geographically peripheral city (both in Europe and in the Iberian Peninsula) and considering that until recently most teachers of the conservatory were itinerant, it was difficult to maintain long-term educational projects.

Currently, the conservatory's staff has become steady and this has allowed inquisitiveness and initiatives on behalf of the teachers to rise so that the educational aims of the conservatory are now modern, innovative and with a European dimension.

With this project, the staff at the CMUS Xoán Montes has decided to carry out a KA1 project to help improve the teachers' competences and observe the different European educational centres of similar or higher characteristics to ours (the management made of their educational and human resources, the management of space, collaboration with other organizations, etc.). We would also like to establish contacts for future collaborations and directly involve the rest of the educational community.
As for the staff involved in the project, a team of 17 teachers of different instrumental specialities and coordinated by two teachers (bassoon and clarinet) work together in the development and organization of this international project.

The conservatory wants to promote an education based on quality, encourage the use of foreign languages and provide education with the international dimension needed in order to make our students genuine citizens of Europe.
We seek to have clear signs of identity, amongst which we want to highlight our concern in educational innovation, information technology (IT), basic competences and the use of foreign languages, as well as the importance of diversity. We want to improve our methodological competences and promote the creativity, innovation and modernization of our educational project.

We believe that the contact with professionals from other European schools with different sensitivities and experiences will reinforce the conservatory's European dimension opening it up to new ways of understanding education and teaching.
The teachers' mobility will enable us to improve and enhance their training, both in the linguistic field (updating and refreshing foreign languages) as well as methodologically, broadening their abilities and promoting the creation of new educational resources.

In the medium term, one of the aims of our conservatory is to improve and increase our educational offer in order to enhance and delve into the European dimension of the centre and offer our students a glance of the European diversity and the common values of a musical education. For this, the professional development of the staff is essential, as this will help us to establish contact with teachers from other countries with the hope of creating new projects of collaboration and cooperation with different centres and also be able to count with an ample and diverse network of collaborating centres, both from a geographical and cultural, linguistic point of view.

The training received by the teachers who will participate in the activities, which will help improve their linguistic, social, professional, digital and educational competences, will also be shared with the rest of the conservatory's staff
and with the collaborating centres.

The project designed to achieve all these improvements is planned for a total of two years, and the conservatory's plans as for the mobility activities of the teachers can be summarized as follows:

 - 8 Job-Shadowing in different European countries (Portugal, Hungary, Poland, Norway, Italy, the United Kingdom, Sweden and France).
 - 1 clarinet mechanics course in France.
 - 2 language courses in Ireland.

After carrying out the corresponding analysis of our conservatory's needs, we believe that the European dimension that this project will provide us will help us define clear, innovative signs of identity for our conservatory to become an educational centre of music of reference.

This project seeks to take 60 IVT  SCCB Students from disadvantaged backgrounds (aged 16-21) from Birmingham, on a 2 week work placement around the IT, Business and Science vocational sector to Limerick, Ireland, Some of the students will be active apprentices, 

Participants will be taken in 4 flows of 15 and will be accompanied by SCCB Staff. Our project outcome is to ensure that these YP can after completion of the placements go on to find and sustain a learning, training or a work opportunity. Participants will be YP (aged 16-21) who are undertaking various types of courses at SCCB, that include:

Business
Award in Computerised Book Keeping (SAGE) Level 1, 2, 3
BTEC Diploma in Business Administration Level 1
 BTEC Level 2 Extended Certificate in Business
ILM Award in Team Leading Level 2
Intermediate Apprenticeship in Business Administration
Advanced Apprenticeship in Business Administration
BTEC Diploma in Business Level 3

IT
BTEC Diploma in IT Level 1
Databases Software Level 1, 2
Spreadsheets Level 1, 2
Word Processing Level 1, 2
BTEC Diploma in ICT Systems Support Level 2
BTEC Extended Certificate in Information and Creative Technology Level 2
Intermediate Apprenticeship IT Technician
Introduction to Cyber Security Level 2
Word Processing Level 2
 
Science Courses:
BTEC Diploma in Applied Science Level 1, 2
BTEC National Extended Diploma in Applied Science Level 3

Employability Skills Level 1 (Problem Solving, Team work, Presenting Yourself / Coping with Change)

Our YP will come from local communities from the Birmingham Area. Many of our YP will be from poor and disadvantaged backgrounds. These YP will have poor education and employment histories and be struggling to stay in education as a consequence of the withdrawal of the EMA as well as the current round of welfare cuts.  We aim to attract both young males and females. Our project will be inclusive and open to all candidates that meet our selection criteria

SCCB - Lead and Sending Partner:  SCCB is now keen to develop and manage more  vocational placement project that can provide real value to our learners, by equipping them with classroom and real work related skills directly relevant to the qualifications/skills that they are seeking to develop. SCCB is eager to send students from the college to Ireland to experience work in a different setting - that will develop all aspects of our YP. This will give them a head start in the labour market, because real work experience is something that our students currently lack with almost 35% of our college leavers unable to find work on completion of their courses.

Host Partner:  LCETB is elected on the basis of our preparatory visit, its track record, it has managed and hosted a number of Erasmus+  Projects and Placements and is familiar with all the requirements of the programme (managing work placements, providing cultural activities, monitoring, practical support). LCETB is also able to provide our disadvantaged participants with state of the art work placement opportunities with large scale employers that are not available to our YP as well as struyctured college based learning based on their . Youth reach programme

What needs will be addressed?
•Provide opportunity to capture and accredit practical skills in a work environment that can be used as part of the qualifications that YP are studying towards  
•Improve self-confidence/aspirations
•Acquire employability and language skills, so they have a better chance of employment or further training 
•Independant Living Skills 
•Broaden the outlook of our YP - see themselves as mobile Europeans

This project builds on our (and our YPs,) learning experiences from collaborative projects with our  Euro Mechanics, Spark and Local to Global, projects  which have highlighted the need to help students develop real work experiences that challenges them and builds their confidence to find and sustain real work opportunities as well as progress within their chosen careers. Evidence has shown from our IVT project that through a robust work placement all of our students found work or continued with their education and gaining the qualifications they sought. This IVT project will push our YP to learn and develop their skills by showing them what they can achieve as well as be able to live and work in a different environment..
Aston Athletics Basketball Club Community Interest Company

CONTEXT

Birmingham A's Basketball Club  is the largest community interest basketball club in the UK. Since 2013, the proven impacts of its programmes have been replicated and disseminated across a network of like-minded community basketball organisations in the UK (The BME Coaches Consortium).

OBJECTIVES

The primary aim of this project is to further enhance and improve the vocational training and development of students at the consortium partner Basketball Academies, which provide the opportunity for talented athletes to develop their skills in a professional basketball environment whilst also achieving vocational qualifications. Working with Obila Basket in Spain, the project will also aim to provide greater exit and progression opportunities for students upon completion of the Academy programme. The project will have 3 overarching strategic objectives: 

1. Enhance the vocational training programmes and learning performance of participants through the delivery of high quality activities that meet formal learning outcomes of their vocational qualifications.

2. Enhance the employability of participants through the development of life skills and exposure to European progression opportunities in both sport and other careers.

3. Facilitate the exchange of European best practice through the transfer of training methods, development environments, techniques and philosophies into both the consortium Basketball Academy programmes and students.

NUMBER AND PROFILE OF PARTICIPANTS

60 participants will be selected from the circa 150 (male & female) students undertaking the Basketball Academy programme at consortium partner organisations in the 2017/18 academic year. These students are selected primarily on the basis of their basketball ability & therefore incorporate a wide range of academic abilities, socioeconomic circumstances and ethnic backgrounds.

PROJECT ACTIVITIES

The majority of the project activities will take place at Obila Basket, including:
-  Technical sessions to address the defined sports performance targets. 
- Games v high quality Spanish youth teams.
- Daily feedback and evaluation sessions to confirm goal setting/reflection.

Obila Basket has outstanding links at a local, regional and national level which will enable the consortium to enhance the project activities of participants. For example:
- Access to high quality local and regional basketball clubs with activities to include training sessions and games at world class training facilities.
- A visit to the Spanish Basketball Federation to undertake work shadowing, observe the professional practices and explore exit pathways.
- Observation of a live Spanish professional basketball fixtures.

METHODOLGY

Our Project Manager, Nigel Hanson, is a qualified PRINCE2 practitioner and we will therefore use PRINCE2 methodology to ensure the effectively delivery of the all aspects of the project, including:

- Clear definition of the project team's individual ROLES AND RESPONSIBILITIES in order for them to effectively manage the project.
- A three-stage QUALITY MANAGMENT process (Planning, Assurance, Control) to address key quality and management issues throughout the life-cycle of the project.
- A detailed PROJECT WORK PLAN outlining the steps required to develop the project activities and PRINCE2 techniques that should be used.
- A COMMUNICATIONS MANAGEMENT STRATEGY clarifying the project stakeholders, the key information required by each and the timescales for delivery.
- Clear guidelines with regard to how the project will be MONITORED & EVALUATED at each stage.

IMPACTS

The impacts on participants are expected to include:
- Achievement of recognised vocational qualifications. 
- Development of life skills and experience that can be utilised throughout participants' education and careers.
- Enhanced cultural and linguistic skills, facilitating openness to new opportunities both in the UK and Europe.
- Improved knowledge and understanding of the European opportunities in sport and other careers.

The impacts on B-MECC expected to include:
- Enhancement of the Basketball Academy programmes both in terms of improved technical sporting quality of students and coaches, and also student achievement rates. 
- Implementation of best practice across the Academy programmes and also the wider activities.
- Improved exit and progression opportunities for students, both within sport and outside of it, and in the UK and Europe.
Aston Athletics Basketball Club Community Interest Company
Aston Athletics Basketball Club Community Interest Company

CONTEXT

Birmingham A's Basketball Club is the largest community interest basketball club in the UK. Since 2013, the proven impacts of its programmes have been replicated and disseminated across a network of like-minded community basketball organisations in the UK (The BME Coaches Consortium).

OBJECTIVES

The Birmingham A's and the SCS community programmes are  fundamental to providing young people, particularly those from disadvantaged backgrounds, with enhanced competences that create a desire for lifelong learning. As a result of the economic downturn, and the refugee crisis that has seen increased intolerance and social exclusion within disadvantaged communities, opportunities for young people to acquire the competences that will enable them to participate effectively in society are increasingly scarce. This project will seek to address these issues through the delivery of 4 overarching strategic objectives: 

1. Via the delivery of a range of targeted formal and non-formal training interventions, evidence a direct impact on 60 vulnerable and disadvantaged young people aged 14-16 years old, living in some of the most economically deprived areas in each of the partner countries.

2. Facilitate the transfer of European training methods, development environments, techniques and philosophies into the Birmingham A's and SCS community programmes and the young people they target.

3. Expose participants to the European opportunities in both sport and other careers so these can be explored and more readily understood, accepted and pursued in the future.

4. Embed lifelong learning principles into the training and development programme and working cultures in order to equip participants with the aptitude and skills to pursue employment, either within sport or outside of it, throughout their career.

NUMBER AND PROFILE OF PARTICIPANTS

60 participants will be selected from the 1000+ (male & female) young people undertaking programmes within each of the project partners during the 2017/18 academic year. The young people that participate in these programmes are selected on the basis of their learning and development needs, so therefore incorporate a wide range of academic abilities, socioeconomic circumstances and ethnic backgrounds.

PROJECT ACTIVITIES

The majority of the project activities will take place at the facilities of Birmingham A's/SCS, including:
- Experiencing and observing high quality European basketball.
- Exposure to a range of job roles within a professional European environment.
- Education/workshop sessions.
- Social and cultural activities.
- Feedback and evaluation sessions.

METHODOLGY

The project partners will use the principles of the European Quality Charter to set goals and define tasks for the key elements of the project:

1) INFORMATION AND GUIDANCE: production of clear and accessible resources.
2) LEARNING PLAN: clearly defining the project objectives and the role of each partner in achieving them.
3) PERSONALISATION: pre-visit assessment of participants' desired learning outcomes.
4) PREPARATION: a structured preparation programme tailored to individual needs.
5) LANGUAGE: provision of formal and informal language training.
6) LOGISTICS: a formal contract to be signed by both parties outlining practical and logistical responsibilities.
7) MENTORING: provision of suitably qualified staff to facilitate achievement of individual goals and ensure integration.
8) RECOGNITION: delivery of formal instruments to recognise individual learning outcomes.
9) EVALUATION: comprehensive and objective evaluation of all aspects of the project.
10) RESPONSIBILITIES: agreement by all parties on their roles and responsibilities in the successful delivery of the project, formalised in writing via a Memorandum of Understanding and individual participant Learning Plans.

IMPACTS

The project will provide participants with the skills and experience that will enhance their employability and ability to contribute positively to the local/regional society and economy, with the following desired impacts:

- Developing and deploying employable young people into the local and regional community. 
- Developing key partnerships to increase numbers of players, coaches, officials and administrators accessing sporting opportunities. 
- Increasing the number and range of opportunities for students to participate in sport. 
- Development of life skills and experience that can be utilised throughout participants' education and careers.
- Enhanced cultural and linguistic skills, facilitating openness to new opportunities both in the UK and Europe.
- Improved knowledge and understanding of the European opportunities in sport and other careers.
- Improved exit and progression opportunities for students, both within sport and outside of it, and in the UK, Bulgaria and Europe.

Zuid Europa.

Every year Friesland College managed to increase the number of teachers and students going abroad. We actively support these international mobilities, not only in Europe but also in developing countries.  The objective is to create more awareness of the growing globalisation and the  impact it has on our lifestyle and the economic development in Europe and beyond. We want to make them realize that a united Europe and a good cooperation between the member states are crucial for a stable economic Europe.  Especially in view of countries leaving the European union and the rise of the populist parties.
We aim at offering challenging education in general, not only by creating an international programme of Excellence for our VET+ students of level 4EQF but also for developing the talents of our students of level 2 EQF, with a socially challenged background by offering them a placement abroad. 

Our continuous goal is to maintain the high standard of QUALITY OF PLACEMENTS abroad by using solid and renomated training companies,  by consulting the Dutch recognition organisation SBB, the intermediate organisations in the host country and by using the network of our educational partners abroad . This is safeguarded by agreements with companies in the context of EQF and the new Qualification files of the Dutch government and by usung Learning Agreements, ECVET,  MOU, Europass and other instruments for agreements on content, monitoring, validation, recognition and evaluation of the experiences abroad. They are the key for a succesful study period or a project abroad. 

Special attention will be paid to our LEVEL 2 EQF STUDENTS of Facility Management and Care taking, (SOCIAL INCLUSION GROUP)  the socially challenged group of youngsters who we offer a placement of 3 weeks  abroad for their personal growth en to improve their position on the labour market. 

Professionals are going abroad for sjobhadowing , training courses and workshops in order to find new teaching methods and to describe Learning Units and Learning Outcomes for ECVET matters in collaboration with our international partners . Teachers will focus on curriculum comparison.  Personal and PROFESSIONAL DEVELOPMENT OF TEACHERS is becoming increasingly important in relation to Excellence and quality control. Master Studies with an international scope are stimulated by the Management 

We will continue to gather information on SOCIAL ENTREPRENEURSHIP, the new approach of empowering students. Students of level 4+ EQF  need to focus on a more personified and individualized career path to reach personal goals.  Communication skills, using English in a natural setting, meeting young people in other countries, being part of their peer-to-peer training in social entrepreneurship is a good source for empowerment.  Developing personal leadership in a programme of excellence enables them to follow a path of growth, on a multisectoral level.
Our objective is to empower students in realizing a fulfilling, satisfying, fruitful life and career, either in Europe or in our region .
Teachers and students wil be trained abroad within the companies involved. This enables students to develop the 4  Binckley 2020 competences of 21st century skills : creativity, critical thinking, communication and collaboration.  This training enables students to start up companies while studying.  
The collaboration with Higher Education students will be extented within the proposed KA2 project Claim your Future. They will  be involved for guidance of our students and for research matters. 


Apart from the above mentioned topics , this project will focus  on the effect of CAPITALS OF CULTURE 2018 : Leeuwarden and Valletta (Malta) on the cultural diversity, economic situation of the regions involved and labour markets. The mobilities will increase, including incoming students . 
A large number of students and a few young entrepreneurs support the projects of Leeuwarden 2018.  Previous capitals of culture will be involved in this project. There is an intensive collaboration with the internal training company of the Friesland College: Leeuwarden 2018 Do it!  (http://www.frieslandcollege.nl/leeuwarden-2018-do-it.html)
With MCAST and other institutes and companies on Malta, we have an extensive exchange of knowledge, experiences and good practices in the field of culture,  clean energy, water management and entrepreneurship.
Learning from Best Practice: Modernizing and Improving VET in Limerick and Clare Education and Training Boards’ (LCETB ) Further Education and Training Division

The title of this project is Learning from Best Practice: Modernizing and Improving VET in Limerick and Clare Education and Training Boards’ (LCETB) Further Education and Training Division. We are working with VET institutions in Europe who will host short observation and job shadowing placements for our staff. Our host organisations all work in Vocational Education and Training at Levels 3, 4 and 5 of the European Qualifications Framework 

The overall aim of the project is to build staff capacity to implement new strategies and responses to key topics in VET. 
Each partner will devise a series of activities which explore the objectives below. Once funding is approved we will work with the partners to put in place a comprehensive agenda of activities for each visit. 
The following are the objectives of this project with each visit exploring 4 or 5 over a visit depending on the areas of expertise each host would like to showcase. 
1. To identify ways to include employers and labour market needs in curriculum design and delivery and to look at links with local employers and industry. (Employer Engagement)
2. To identify effective methods for the recruitment of learners in the context of changing labour market including looking at innovative marketing and PR Strategies  (Recruitment)
3. To learn how organisations support learners needs e.g. disability, literacy or numeracy difficulties, language needs  (Reducing Barriers to Learning)
4. Identify effective models of career guidance (Career Guidance) 
5. To investigate how organisations foster social inclusion and promote multiculturalism (Diversity and Inclusion)
6. To look at areas of curricular excellence and innovation in Technology Enhanced Learning,  TEL (Teaching and Learning )
7. To identify innovative models of staff professional development especially around internationalisation (Professional Development)
8. To identify innovation in Quality Assurance (Quality Assurance)
Each visit will be focused on exploring key themes as set out in our objectives. Visits would be mixture of formal and informal presentations, sites visits combined with classroom visits and potential job shadowing. The expectation is that those on the mobility would be together for the as a group first half of the visits, and then participating in classroom observation or job shadowing.  
Project Visit One- Birmingham- Autumn/Winter 2018
Project Visit Two Portugal- Spring 2019
Project Visit Three Austria-Spring 2020
In total there will be 24 participants on 3 mobilities over 24 months. The following are the target groups. Action Plan Implementation Group Members, Managers and Leaders, Learning Practitioners, Support Services Staff (Guidance etc.)
Methodology

The EU Project Team will work with the managers and senior managers and Implementation Group Chairs to identify and encourage staff members to participate in the project. Interested participants will then complete a short application process. As well as outlining their interest in the mobility they will undertake to engage fully in all dissemination and evaluation activities planned. 

We will work closely with all our partner organisations to look at developing detailed visit briefs ensuring all participants gain from the experience.

Impacts

Staff will have increased exposure to the latest thinking in the areas of Enterprise Engagement, Recruitment, Reducing Barriers to Learning, Career Guidance, Diversity and Inclusion, Teaching and Learning and Professional Development and Quality Assurance. They will have increased confidence in looking to implement new and innovative strategies either in their own practice, their centre of at service level. They will have and enhanced opportunity to reflect on their own practice as well as sharing knowledge, ideas and practice with colleagues from across the service and with European colleagues. 

At organisation level there will be increased connections between VET centres and new European partners as a result of staff networking on project mobilities. Over the long term we expect be able to demonstrate enhanced quality and relevance of our learning programmes to learners, employers, communities and other stakeholders and to be widely recognised for the quality of our teaching & learning including effective use of TEL. We also expect that at both regional and national level to continue to raise the profile of FET Division. We would hope that we would be able to host our partner organisations in Limerick and Clare Education and Training Board in to the future.

Υπόβαθρο του προτεινόμενου έργου:
Η Ομάδα Διαχείρισης Εκπαιδευτικών Προγραμμάτων (ΟΔΕΠ)της Διεύθυνσης Νοσηλευτικών Υπηρεσιών (ΔΝΥ) του Υπουργείου Υγείας, έχει την αποκλειστική ευθύνη της εκπαίδευσης των νοσηλευτών του δημόσιου τομέα και μέρους του ιδιωτικού τομέα στα πλαίσια της συνεχούς επαγγελματικής τους ανάπτυξης και ασχολείται με την πραγματοποίηση εκπαιδευτικών προγραμμάτων μικρής και μεγάλης διάρκειας.   Η σημασία των αναθεωρημένων αναλυτικών προγραμμάτων αλλά και η ένταξη καινοτόμων εκπαιδευτικών μεθόδων μέσω προηγμένου υλικοτεχνικού εξοπλισμού θεωρείται υψίστης σημασίας, προκειμένου να επιτυγχάνονται ποιοτικά εκπαιδευτικά προγράμματα. Αυτό θα επιφέρει αφενός νέες γνώσεις και δεξιοτητες προς τους εκπαιδευόμενους και αφετέρου βελτίωση του επιπέδου της παρεχόμενης φροντίδας.

Στόχοι έργου:
- Η βελτίωση της ποιότητας τόσο των εκπαιδεύσεων όσο και του εκπαιδευτικού υλικού που παρέχεται μέσα από τα εκπαιδευτικά προγράμματα της ΟΔΕΠ. 
-Η ανάπτυξη και την ενσωμάτωση, στα προγράμματα σπουδών της ΟΔΕΠ,  νέων καινοτόμων τεχνικών και εργαλείων εκπαίδευσης, που αφορούν στον τομέα της υγείας.
- Η αναγνώριση καινούργιων μεθόδων και πρακτικών  που να προωθούν την εφαρμογή/υιοθέτηση των νέων γνώσεων και δεξιοτήτων, που αποκτούνται από τους εκπαιδευόμενους,  στο χώρο εργασίας τους, προκειμένου να βελτιωθεί το επίπεδο της παρεχόμενης φροντίδας.
 - Η δημιουργία Ευρωπαϊκών συνδέσμων για την ανάπτυξη μελλοντικών συνεργασιών. 

Συμμετέχοντες: 
Τα τρία άτομα  που εμπλέκονται στη συγκεκριμένη αίτηση και αναφέρονται ως άτομα επαφής, ανήκουν στην ΟΔΕΠ και έχουν πολυετή εμπειρία στην νοσηλευτική εκπαίδευση.  Είναι όλοι κάτοχοι  ακαδημαϊκών προσόντων στη νοσηλευτική (MSc, PhD).  Έχουν εργαστεί στη Νοσηλευτική Σχολή Κύπρου καθώς επίσης και στο Τμήμα Νοσηλευτικής του ΤΕΠΑΚ ως Ειδικό Επιστημονικό Προσωπικό, πραγματοποιώντας διδασκαλία σε διάφορα μαθήματα  καθώς και εργαστήρια σε διάφορες νοσηλευτικές ειδικότητες σε προπτυχιακά αλλά και μεταπτυχιακά προγράμματα .  Και τα τρία άτομα που εμπλέκονται στη συγκεκριμένη αίτηση είχαν την υπευθυνότητα στο σχεδιασμό και στην ανάπτυξη των προ - αναφερόμενων προγραμμάτων εξειδίκευσης μεγάλης διάρκειας (Eντατική Νοσηλευτική, Περιεγχειρητική Νοσηλευτική και Φροντίδα Σακχαρώδη Διαβήτη).  

Περιγραφή των δραστηριοτήτων/Mεθοδολογία που θα χρησιμοποιηθεί:
Το πλάνο κινητικότητας και οι  δραστηριότητες που προγραμματίζει ο οργανισμός θα σχεδιαστούν με  σκοπό την  πλήρη κάλυψη των αναγκών του.     Η κινητικότητα 1 αφορά στην οργάνωση ενός πλάνου εργασίας για τους συμμετέχοντες που θα συμπεριλαμβάνει προκαθορισμένες στοχευμένες συναντήσεις των αιτούντων με τους ακαδημαϊκά υπεύθυνους των αντίστοιχων  προγραμμάτων/εξειδικεύσεων του οργανισμού υποδοχής.  Σε αυτές τις συναντήσεις θα πραγματοποιηθούν παρουσιάσεις για το αναλυτικό πρόγραμμα των 3 εκπαιδευτικών προγραμμάτων (Εντατική Νοσηλευτική, Περιεγχειριτική Νοσηλευτική, Νοσηλευτική στο Διαβήτη), από τους εκπροσώπους και των δύο οργανισμών. Επιπρόσθετα, θα προγραμματιστούν επισκέψεις για τους συμμετέχοντες,  στον κλινικό χώρο του πανεπιστημιακού νοσοκομείου με το οποίο συνεργάζεται ο οργανισμός υποδοχής για παρακολούθηση  του τρόπου διεξαγωγής της κλινικής άσκησης.       Αυτή η κινητικότητα  θα έχει ως σκοπό την ανταλλαγή απόψεων καθώς και την αλληλεπίδραση μεταξύ των δύο (αιτών οργανισμού και του οργανισμού υποδοχής) ως προς την πρώτη ανάγκη για αναθεώρηση και σύγκριση των αναλυτικών προγραμμάτων (Curriculum) για τα συγκεκριμένα εκπαιδευτικά προγράμματα   Κατά τη  2η  κινητικότητα (διάρκειας 1 εβδομάδας) οι συμμετέχοντες θα έχουν την ευκαιρία να παρακολουθήσουν κάποιες νέες διδακτικές μεθόδους (ο καθένας στην εξειδίκευση με την οποία ασχολείται) κατά τη διάρκεια διεξαγωγής των συγκεκριμένων προγραμμάτων από τον οργανισμό υποδοχής μέσω σκιώδους εργασίας.  Επιπλέον, θα προγραμματιστούν δραστηριότητες που θα αφορούν επισκέψεις στους εργαστηριακούς χώρους διδασκαλίας  και ενημέρωση για κάποια προπλάσματα ή και άλλο υλικοτεχνικό εξοπλισμό που χρησιμοποιείται για σκοπούς εκπαίδευσης.   Με αυτή τη κινητικότητα οι συμμετέχοντες θα αποκτήσουν νέα γνώση και εμπειρίες για ένταξη καινούργιων μεθόδων διδασκαλίας ή νέων εργαλείων στη δική τους πρακτική. Κατά την 3η  κινητικότητα ο αιτών οργανισμός θα πραγματοποιήσει συναντήσεις και συζητήσεις με τους διευθυντές των πανεπιστημιακών νοσοκομείων με τα οποία συνεργάζεται ο οργανισμός υποδοχής για τη κλινική άσκηση των φοιτητών, σχετικά με τους πιο αποτελεσματικούς τρόπους για την εφαρμογή της νέας γνώσης στη κλινική πρακτική.
Αποτελέσματα/Ωφέλη: 
H συγκεκριμένη Κινητικότητα θα δώσει ευκαιρίες και κίνητρα στους εκπαιδευτές της ΟΔΕΠ, να αποκτήσουν εκπαιδευτικές και επαγγελματικές εμπειρίες,  προκειμένου να εμπλουτίσουν το επαγγελματικό τους έργο και κατ'επέκταση να αναπτύσσουν αναβαθμισμένα προγράμματα εκπαίδευσης εναρμονισμένα με διεθνή πρότυπα,  με τη χρήση καινούργιων και  καινοτόμων διδακτικών προσεγγίσεων.
Aston Athletics Basketball Club Community Interest Company

CONTEXT

Birmingham A's Basketball Club  is the largest community interest basketball club in the UK, . Since 2013, the proven impacts of its programmes have been replicated and disseminated across a network of like-minded community basketball organisations in the UK (The BME Coaches Consortium).

OBJECTIVES

The primary aim of this project is to further enhance and improve the vocational training and development of students at the consortium partner Basketball Academies, which provide the opportunity for talented athletes to develop their skills in a professional basketball environment whilst also achieving vocational qualifications. Working with Pro Sports Academy in Malta, the project will also aim to provide greater exit and progression opportunities for students upon completion of the Academy programme. The project will have 3 overarching strategic objectives: 

1. Enhance the vocational training programmes and learning performance of participants through the delivery of high quality work placements that meet vocational learning outcomes of their vocational qualifications.

2. Enhance the employability of participants through the development of life skills and exposure to European progression opportunities in both sport and other careers.

3. Facilitate the exchange of European best practice through the transfer of training methods, development environments, techniques and philosophies into both the consortium Basketball Academy programmes and students.

NUMBER AND PROFILE OF PARTICIPANTS

60 participants will be selected from the circa 218 (male & female) students undertaking the Basketball Academy programme at consortium partner organisations in the 2017/18 academic year. These students are selected primarily on the basis of their basketball ability & therefore incorporate a wide range of academic abilities, socioeconomic circumstances and ethnic backgrounds.

PROJECT ACTIVITIES

The majority of the work placement activities will take place at Pro Sport academy facilities, including:
-  Technical sessions to address the defined sports performance targets. 
- Observation of games v high quality Maltese National U18 youth teams.
- Daily feedback and evaluation sessions to confirm goal setting/reflection.

Pro Sports Academy has outstanding links at a local, regional and national level which will enable the consortium to enhance the work placement activities of participants. For example:
- Access to high quality local and regional basketball clubs with activities to include training sessions and games at world class training facilities.
- A visit to the Maltese Basketball Federation to undertake work placements & observe the professional practices and explore exit pathways.
- Observation of a live Maltese professional basketball fixture
- Observation & Sharing of a best practice via two month staff training abroad 

METHODOLGY

Our Project Manager, Nigel Hanson, is a qualified PRINCE2 practitioner and we will therefore use PRINCE2 methodology to ensure the effectively delivery of the all aspects of the project, including:

- Clear definition of the project team's individual ROLES AND RESPONSIBILITIES in order for them to effectively manage the project.
- A three-stage QUALITY MANAGMENT process (Planning, Assurance, Control) to address key quality and management issues throughout the life-cycle of the project.
- A detailed PROJECT WORK PLAN outlining the steps required to develop the project activities and PRINCE2 techniques that should be used.
- A COMMUNICATIONS MANAGEMENT STRATEGY clarifying the project stakeholders, the key information required by each and the timescales for delivery.
- Clear guidelines with regard to how the project will be MONITORED & EVALUATED at each stage.

IMPACTS

The impacts on participants are expected to include:
- Achievement of recognised vocational qualifications. 
- Development of life skills and experience that can be utilised throughout participants' education and careers.
- Enhanced cultural and linguistic skills, facilitating openness to new opportunities both in the UK and Europe.
- Improved knowledge and understanding of the European opportunities in sport and other careers.

The impacts on B-MECC expected to include:
- Enhancement of the Basketball Academy programmes both in terms of improved technical sporting quality of students and coaches, and also student achievement rates. 
- Implementation of best practice across the Academy programmes and also the wider activities.
- Improved exit and progression opportunities for students, both within sport and outside of it, and in the UK and Europe.

Ambassadeurs voor Europa door Erasmus+ : beter onderwijs  voor iedereen door kennisuitwisseling in Europa

"Every student internationally  competent "  is  Friesland College's slogan in the upcoming policy plan in 2018. Presently we focus on increasing  the number of students and professionals going abroad and on receiving more students from our 
European partners, not only for VET but also for Adult Education. Our strategic partnerships strenghten the bond with our partners abroad. Curriculum comparison and exchange of good practice enriches our educational programmes.  Students share their experiences with peers and on social media and their enthousiasm make them the best Ambassadors for Europe. We want our students to get acquainted with European values and to get used to working with people from different cultures.  Internationally compent students also means focus on Internationalisation at Home. Workshops, cross-sectoral projects and choice modules International 1 and 2 are already part of the curriculum.

The quality of our placements abroad remains one of our goals. Therefore we use solid and renowned training companies recognised by SBB. This is safeguarded by agreements with companies in the context of the new Qualification files of the Dutch government. In the Learning Agreements of Friesland College (i-BPV) content, monitoring, validation, recognition and evaluation of the experiences abroad is described. 

The realisation of ErasmusPro placements for apprentices is a new challenge.  Some of the education programmes will investigate the possibilities for students with an employee contract to go abroad for a special training for at least 3 months.  That requires consultation with employers.  For that reason, we will apply for some Advanced Planned Visits.(APV) 

We will give attention to the European Year of Cultural Heritage 2018  for those countries that  joined this initiative.  An assignment will be incorporated in the choice module International 2 (Working abroad) as well as an elaborate preparation for their period abroad.  
Modern Language choice modules,  in view of the professional context, can be considered as a new element in the Erasmus+ grant allocation. 
 
Developing SOCIAL ENTREPRENEURSHIP, the new approach of empowering students of level  4+ EQF.   Communication skills, using English in a natural setting, meeting young people in other countries, being part of their peer-to-peer training in social entrepreneurship are themes within this programme. Developing personal leadership in a programme of excellence enables them to follow a path of growth, on a multisectoral level. Teachers and students will be trained abroad within the companies involved.  This training enables students to start up companies while studying.  The collaboration with Higher Education students will be extented. They will  be involved for guidance of our students and for research matters.

We continue our social inclusion project for our 2EQFstudents of Facility Management and Care taking,  the socially challenged group of students who we offer a placement of 3 weeks  on Malta for their personal growth and for improving their position on the labour market. This group will be accompanied by 2 professionals. An elaborate selection procedure and extensive preparation is part of the allocation proces. 

Internationally competent students demand international competent teachers. Personal and professional development  is becoming increasingly important in relation to Excellence and quality control and in view of their role as Ambassador.  The professionals are well aware of the importance of their input and influence on the educational programmes.
Improving the educational proces and stimulating new innovative approaches in education  within Europe through curriculum comparison,  exchanging of good practice, jobshadowing,  workshops are part of the assignments for our staff. They will also be involved in describing Learning Units and Learning Outcomes for ECVET matters.  The difference in educational systems in Europe remains a challenge.

Leeuwarden and Valletta (Malta) are the Capitals of Culture 2018.  Sharing our experiences of the effect on the cultural diversity, economic situation of the regions involved and labour markets is one of the goals we want to achieve.   A large number of students and teachers support the projects of Cultural Capitals.  The number of  outgoing and incoming students from countries involved increase enormously.  Friesland College has  full heartedly committed to joining  the festivities and supporting the activities and international cooperation. In this call attention will be paid to sharing our experiences with  students and professionals in Plovdiv (Bulgaria) and Matera (Italy), the capitals of culture in 2019.

STEAMHouse is a demand-led demonstrator showing how the Arts can be combined with Science, Technology, Engineering and Maths (STEAM) to generate innovative products and drive economic growth.
  The project will support innovation in the Priority Growth Sectors identified in the LEPs Smart Specialisation Strategy  (Advanced Manufacturing, Low Carbon, Health and Creative & Digital);  will accept challenges in fields connected to the eight great technologies identified nationally; and meets the priority identified in the ESIF Strategy to strengthen collaboration between elements of the innovation ecosystem and between sectors. 

The project offers good value for money and compares favourably with the programme benchmarks.
